Strength training is an essential component of overall fitness, and targeting your core, glutes, and legs will help improve your cycling and running performance. Here's a routine you can follow, with exercises and sets/reps to get you started:

**Warm-up (5-10 minutes):**

* Light cardio such as jogging, jumping jacks, or cycling
* Dynamic stretching, focusing on your legs, glutes, and lower back

**Monday (Core and Glutes):**

1. **Plank**: 3 sets, holding for 30-60 seconds each
	* Engage your core, keep your back straight, and avoid letting your hips sag
2. **Glute Bridges**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top
3. **Russian twists**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (each side)
	* Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, twist your torso to left and right, touching your hands to the ground each time
4. **Side plank (each side)**: 3 sets, holding for 30-60 seconds each
	* Lie on your side with feet stacked, engage your core, and lift your hips off the ground

**Wednesday (Legs):**

1. **Squats**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, lower your body down into a squat, keeping your back straight and knees behind your toes
2. **Lunges**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (each leg)
	* Stand with feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, lower your body down into a lunge, keeping your back straight and front knee behind your toes
3. **Calf raises**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Stand on the edge of a step or platform, raise up onto your tiptoes, and lower back down
4. **Leg press or leg extensions**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Use a leg press machine or do leg extensions with dumbbells, focusing on extending your legs and then lowering them back down

**Friday (Core and Glutes):**

1. **Deadlifts**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a weight or dumbbells, lift the weight up to hip level, squeezing your glutes and pushing your hips back
2. **Step-ups**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps (each leg)
	* Stand in front of a step or platform, step up with one foot, and bring the other foot up to meet it
3. **Glute-ham raises**: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes and pushing your heels towards the floor
4. **Plank jacks**: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds
	* Start in a plank position, jump your feet out to the sides, and back in towards your body, repeating the motion

**Cool-down (5-10 minutes):**

* Static stretching, focusing on your legs, glutes, and lower back

Remember to:

* Start with lighter weights and gradually increase the weight as you build strength
* Focus on proper form and technique throughout each exercise
* Listen to your body and rest when needed, as strength training can be taxing on your muscles
* Incorporate these exercises into your routine 2-3 times a week, allowing for at least one rest day in between

This routine will help improve your overall strength, power, and endurance, which will translate to better performance on the bike and during
